question: The "Merengue Music" is originated from which country?
explanation: The Merengue Music is a mid-19th century Latin American type of music and dance originated from the island country of the Dominican Republic in the Hispaniola Islands of the Greater Antilles Archipelago in the West Indies-Caribbean region. This music genre has Central African-Congo stylistic origins and was promoted to a large extent by Rafael Trujillo, the former President of the Dominican Republic from 1930 to 1961, who turned this music genre into national music and dance style of the Dominican Republic. Merengue music was inscribed by UNESCO on the list of Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity.
